waves.rationale: US-001 creates the foundational color generation utility (src/lib/utils/colorGeneration.ts). Both US-002 and US-003 depend on this utility and import generateDistinctColor() from it. Must complete first before dependent stories can proceed.

US-002 modifies src/routes/api/areas/+server.ts (backend API) while US-003 modifies src/lib/components/areas/AreaModal.svelte (frontend UI). These are completely separate files with no overlap. Both depend only on US-001 (completed in Wave 1). Safe to parallelize - one developer can work on API integration while another works on UI updates simultaneously.

risks: Low risk: US-002 and US-003 both fetch existing area colors but from different contexts (server-side vs client-side). No shared state mutation.
US-003 may need to test against US-002's API changes, but the interface is well-defined (color field in response). Integration testing can happen after both complete.
